New Records: Adolis García set a record for RBI in a postseason series with 15.
Adolis García passed Houston slugger Yordan Alvarez for the most home runs in the playoffs this year with 20.
Adolis García's home run streak is tied for fourth-longest in postseason history.
Key Match Events: Corey Seager got the Rangers started with a long homer in a three-run first inning.
Nathaniel Lowe also went deep to give Texas its first berth in the Fall Classic since consecutive trips in 2010 and 2011.
Adolis García homered for the fourth straight game.
Jordan Montgomery pitched 2 1/3 scoreless innings for the win.
Texas broke things open with a four-run fourth that featured a two-run double by rookie Evan Carter and a two-run single by García.
Adolis García had 15 RBI in the series to break the record set by Nelson Cruz with 13 for Texas in the 2011 ALCS.
Pre-Game Insights: The Rangers were looking to reach their first World Series in 12 years.
The Astros were trying to repeat as World Series champions, but it had been 20 years since a team repeated as champions.
Post-Match Reflections: Bruce Bochy became the first skipper to win a League Championship Series with three different teams.
The Rangers' win guaranteed a third all-wild card World Series, the first since Bochy's Giants beat Kansas City in 2014.
The Astros were finally dethroned as defending World Series champions.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The road team won every game in the series, with the Rangers going 8-0 away from home in the playoffs.
The Rangers' victory marked the second time the road team won every game in a best-of-seven postseason series.
Jose Altuve hit his 27th career postseason homer in the ninth for Houston, two behind Manny Ramirez for most all-time.
